title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 24 March 2015 - XWiki
content:
<abusenius> has quit  
00:35 <sburjan``> has joined #xwiki  
00:38 <sburjan> has quit  
01:48 <lucaa> has quit  
06:16 <Bugendolf> has quit  
06:16 <Bugendolf> has joined #xwiki  
07:05 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
07:57 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:12 <cjd> has quit  
08:17 <msmeria1> has joined #xwiki  
08:17 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
08:18 <msmeria> has quit  
08:40 <lynxt> has quit  
08:41 <lynxt> has joined #xwiki  
08:58 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
09:03 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:28 <tmortagne> as far as I can tell there is only flickering left in jenkins and all issue assinged to 7.0RC1 are closed so I will start the release shortly  
09:29 <tmortagne> s/assinged/assigned/  
09:29 <tmortagne> has quit  
09:30 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:31 <tmortagne> only thing left is some documentation missing for a few closed issue but that's not a blocker for the maven/git release  
09:46 <tmortagne> updating translations  
10:11 <vmassol> good morning  
10:11 <vmassol> cool, smells a release this morning :)  
10:13 <cjd> napalm and dead developers?  
10:13 <cjd> (sorry)  
10:16 <vmassol> cjd: haha vietname still haunting you it seems :)  
10:16 <vmassol> \*vietnam  
10:17 <vmassol> (there's cause for that)  
10:18 <cjd> heh, I count myself lucky to have never seen much more than a fistfight, I suppose if I had I wouldn't talk so loud  
10:22 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:23 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:24 <tmortagne> hold your commits, starting the git/maven release  
10:31 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
10:32 <cjd> is there a way to check for the non-existance of a property value in xwql?  
10:34 <cjd> prop.val = null  -> fail  
10:34 <cjd> prop.val = '' -> fail  
10:34 <cjd> val not in prop -> fail (I tried :)  
10:35 <cjd> prop.val.length < 1 -> fail  
10:35 <cjd> length(prop.val) < 1  -> fail  
10:41 <Enygma`> ... BaseObject o WHERE NOT EXISTS (SELECT p FROM BaseProperty p WHERE p.id.id=o.id.id) ... ?  
10:41 <Enygma`> something along those lines cjd ?  
10:42 <cjd> ahh right, I forgot you can do HQL injection in XWQL  
10:42 <Enygma`> \*o.id  
10:42 <cjd> except then I should just use HQL instead of abusing the XWQL parser  
10:42 <Enygma`> though, I agree, the syntax sux  
10:42 <Enygma`> IMO, XWQL is just syntax sugar  
10:42 <Enygma`> on top of HQL  
10:43 <cjd> I seem to recall some people see XWQL as an abstraction which makes hibernate optional  
10:44 <cjd> but I tend to agree with you, in practice this abstraction will never work  
10:44 <vmassol> it does, we use it every day :)  
10:44 <vmassol> it makes writing 90% of queries in a much simpler way  
10:44 <vmassol> that's a lot already  
10:44 <cjd> different point, indeed it makes things easier  
10:45 <cjd> but as Enygma` points out, it's still married to hibernate  
10:46 <cjd> whereas HQL abstracts away the differences between mysql and postgres, XWQL does not abstract away the differences between hibernate and $something\_else  
10:46 <cjd> unless that $something\_else is effectively the same as hibernate :)  
10:46 <vmassol> indeed that's the best part but it doesn't have to be  
10:46 <vmassol> it's just our implementation which is not finished  
10:47 <vmassol> we translate XWQL to hibernate but we allow passing HQL in the translation  
10:47 <cjd> /nod  
10:47 <vmassol> s/best part/bad part  
10:47 <cjd> you'd have to ban that in order to be DB agnostic  
10:47 <vmassol> yup  
10:48 <cjd> after 2 years, I've started using it... saves keystrokes  
10:50 <tmortagne> cjd: hibernate does not ban databases specifics either, you can use things that will work only on MySQL etc  
10:50 <cjd> interesting point  
10:51 <tmortagne> hql is to the "native" database SQL what XWQL is to hql in practice  
10:52 <tmortagne> and quite frankly hibernate does not abstract much  
11:18 <vmassol> I would love to get more feedback on my thread "[Proposal] Removal of XWiki.RequestsStatus page + agreement to work on integrating Admin Tools in the default flavor" :)  
11:18 <vmassol> (just got Edy's reply so far)  
11:32 <vmassol> tmortagne: could you also reply on the removal of the RequestStatusPage?  
11:32 <vmassol> thanks  
11:33 <tmortagne> crap platform release failing...  
11:33 <vmassol> yuck  
11:33 <tmortagne> as far as I can see the xar plugin produced invalid page when it was executed during translation update  
11:33 <vmassol> (more generally where to move that RequestStatusPage - remove or move)  
11:33 <tmortagne> "Default Language should have been [en] but was []"  
11:36 <gsmeria> has joined #xwiki  
11:36 <tmortagne> actually looks like it was not executed  
11:37 <tmortagne> at least I don't see any commit on https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/stable-7.0.x/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-skin/xwiki-platform-skin-ui/src/main/resources/SkinsCode/Translations.xml  
11:37 <tmortagne> but I don't understand why it validate it during a build and not during release  
11:38 <tmortagne> but I agree with the release failure, having empty default language for a translation is wrong  
11:42 <tmortagne> vmassol: any idea why the xar plugin fail this document only during release ?  
11:43 <vmassol> there shoudln't be a difference between release or not  
11:43 <vmassol> (for the xar plugin's POV)  
11:43 <tmortagne> jenkins does not have any failure and yet the release fail with "Default Language should have been [en] but was []"  
11:44 <vmassol> trying locally  
11:45 <vmassol> are you sure this is not a page that wasn't there on jenkins and that's been added when you added translations?  
11:45 <vmassol> xar:verify is passing fine locally on skin-ui  
11:45 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki  
11:45 <Denis1> is now known as <Denis>  
11:46 <vmassol> indeed SkinsCode.Translations is there on master, but maybe the error is on translations?  
11:46 <tmortagne> this is not a translation  
11:46 <tmortagne> as you can see from the github link I posted  
11:46 <tmortagne> vmassol: could the different come from not having or having other translations ?  
11:46 <vmassol> yes  
11:46 <vmassol> thats how it works  
11:47 <vmassol> in guessDefaultLanguage  
11:47 <vmassol> ()  
11:47 <tmortagne> then we can't see this kind of issue before the release...  
11:47 <vmassol> correct  
11:48 <tmortagne> still xar:format did not fixed it, isn't it supposed to ?  
11:48 <vmassol> it's not implemented at least  
11:49 <tmortagne> seems to me the same algo should be applied to format goal  
11:49 <vmassol> we could I guess  
11:50 <tmortagne> the main issue is that it's not even possible to commit a proper new translation file since it will fail jenkins  
11:51 <vmassol> indeed that's a problem  
11:51 <vmassol> I guess we haven't seen it since we've always had translations at the same time  
11:52 <tmortagne> not really no  
11:52 <tmortagne> we add translation only during releases  
11:52 <vmassol> then I don't understand why we've not seen it  
11:52 <tmortagne> I guess this check is not that old  
11:59 <vmassol> tmortagne: the only thing I can think of would to consider pages named \*Translations as special and always force the default language to be set for them, wdyt?  
11:59 <vmassol> s/would/would be  
12:00 <vmassol> or in a more generic way pass a white list  
12:00 <vmassol> (a white list of regexes)  
12:02 <tmortagne> XCOMMONS-774  
12:02 <tmortagne> making this behavior based on page name configurable trough a maven property should be safe  
12:02 <tmortagne> and enable it by default in commons pom

15:00 <tmortagne> [ANN] 7.0RC1 git/maven release  
15:00 <tmortagne> \*done  
15:01 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
15:01 <msmeria1> has quit  
15:16 <vmassol> vfzevaze: if you need a jira project tell me  
15:19 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
15:21 <vfzevaze> vmassol yes! that would be great  
15:22 <vfzevaze> also please delete my user on jira: 4F2EA2E  
15:22 <vmassol> sure?  
15:22 <vmassol> :)  
15:22 <vfzevaze> yes no problem  
15:22 <vmassol> you have 2?  
15:23 <vfzevaze> then both  
15:23 <vfzevaze> i will create a new one  
15:23 <vmassol> it's a question  
15:23 <vfzevaze> oh no  
15:23 <vfzevaze> only one  
15:23 <vfzevaze> but again only on jira ^^  
15:23 <vmassol> why delete?  
15:23 <vmassol> I can rename  
15:23 <vmassol> (you should be able to renale too)  
15:23 <vfzevaze> it's mispeled and jira don't allow to change it  
15:23 <vmassol> it does for me  
15:23 <vfzevaze> nope  
15:24 <vmassol> ok let me know the new username  
15:24 <vmassol> and I'll change it for you  
15:24 <vfzevaze> 4F2E4A2E  
15:24 <vmassol> what a nice username…  
15:24 <vmassol> done  
15:24 <vfzevaze> thanks alot!  
15:24 <vmassol> cerating project now  
15:24 <vmassol> \*creating  
15:25 <vfzevaze> i am mantaining two projects hpqc- and redmine- macro  
15:26 <vmassol> done: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/HPQC  
15:26 <vmassol> you want a jira for the redmine macro too?  
15:27 <vfzevaze> well, i don't think anyone is using it ^^, but it would make sense right?  
15:27 <vmassol> up to you  
15:27 <vmassol> there are 2 pros: reporting issue and creating jira issues to make your release notes as you implement stuff  
15:27 <vfzevaze> if you say no to github issues, then yes, please create it for jira  
15:28 <vmassol> ok creating it then  
15:28 <vmassol> we want to keep all issues under jira for now  
15:28 <vfzevaze> great!  
15:28 <vmassol> (to allow searching in one place)  
15:28 <vfzevaze> good thing  
15:28 <vfzevaze> consequent, i like it  
15:28 <vmassol> hmm there's already a REDMINE project  
15:29 <vmassol> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XREDMINE  
15:29 <vmassol> and people have already reported issues!  
15:29 <vmassol> you're already lead on it  
15:29 <vmassol> so you should receive the mails  
15:30 <woshilapin> has quit  
15:30 <vfzevaze> i did not receive any emails  
15:31 <vmassol> indeed you don"t  
15:32 <vmassol> the mails go to the [[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection) list  
15:32 <vfzevaze> wow, there are people actually using it  
15:32 <vfzevaze> great  
15:32 <vmassol> yep :)  
15:33 <vmassol> at least some have issues :)  
15:36 <gsmeria> has quit  
15:37 <vfzevaze> another great day in the xwiki community  
15:38 <vfzevaze> thanks!  
15:44 <cjd> Who's O.J. ?  
15:45 <vmassol> vfzevaze: cool  
15:45 <cjd> oic  
15:45 <vfzevaze> me  
15:45 <vfzevaze> why?  
15:46 <cjd> nice name  
15:46 <vfzevaze> ^^  
15:46 \* cjd is able to recignize ascii in hexdumps  
15:46 \* cjd needs a life  
15:47 <vfzevaze> :D  
15:48 <vfzevaze> i have to leave, by guys!  
15:48 <vmassol> bye  
15:48 <cjd> o/  
15:49 <D-Spair> has joined #xwiki  
15:50 <vfzevaze> has quit  
15:53 <vmassol> tmortagne: ok to remove "XWiki.RequestsStatus" (you didn't answer in your reply email)  
15:54 <tmortagne> +0  
15:54 <tmortagne> don't really know this page  
16:00 <tmortagne> Enygma`: I don't remember what you decided in the end, all watchlist plugin classes still exist but deprecated or only the plugin public API ?  
16:00 <tmortagne> adding breakages to the release note  
16:02 <vmassol> tmortagne: AFAIK backward compat is preserved  
16:02 <vmassol> and code in legacy call new component ocde  
16:02 <vmassol> (at least that's what I understood from Edy from a talk a few days ago)  
16:02 <tmortagne> vmassol: I know scripts still work, i'm talking about other public classes  
16:05 <cjd> whois \x90  
16:05 <cjd> oops  
16:05 <cjd> :)  
16:20 <Enygma`> tmortagne: the classes are there, except for the AutomaticWatchModeListener.java and WatchListJob.java  
16:20 <Enygma`> which are internal stuff, even if they were public, and which are now replaced by the classes in the component based implementation  
16:24 <Enygma`> now that I think about it, I might have slipped something on the migration part. AFAICT, existing watchlist job documents will not get updated to use the new WathcListJob class and will try to use the old plugin class which now does not exist.  
16:24 <Enygma`> I will look into that ASAP and fix it for final  
16:54 <vfzevaze> has joined #xwiki  
16:55 <vfzevaze> hi there!  
16:55 <vfzevaze> right now i can't access jira  
16:55 <vfzevaze> is there a know problem to it?  
16:57 <vmassol> vfzevaze: works for me  
16:59 <vfzevaze> well, nothing ipconfig /flushdns can't do  
16:59 <vfzevaze> it works now for me too  
17:01 <KermitTheFragger> has quit  
17:03 <vfzevaze> has quit  
17:03 <vmassol> cool  
17:24 <tmortagne> 7.0RC1 release done  
17:24 <tmortagne> mflorea: don't forget to update the documentation for your issues  
17:26 <mflorea> tmortagne: yep, I'll do it ASAP  
17:27 <tmortagne> (not really complaining, I wrote documentation last week for issues I closed in 7.0M1 :))  
17:28 <mflorea> :)  
17:29 <vfzevaze> has joined #xwiki  
17:35 <tmortagne> vmassol: a few failures seems to be related to your change to AbstractJSR223ScriptMacro  
17:35 <tmortagne> java.lang.NullPointerException  
17:35 <tmortagne>         at org.xwiki.rendering.macro.script.AbstractJSR223ScriptMacro.evaluateBlock(AbstractJSR223ScriptMacro.java:259)  
17:35 <tmortagne> see http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/1098/  
17:35 <vmassol> thanks  
17:35 <vmassol> checking  
17:36 <vmassol> ok fixig  
17:37 <vmassol> BTW I think I'm going to try using a string converter  
17:37 <vmassol> and if it fails then default to using toString()  
17:38 <vmassol> (string converter = converter manager)  
17:40 <tmortagne> will probably provide a better String representation than toString indeed  
17:40 <tmortagne> now I'm not sure the result of eval should be parsed as wiki syntax  
17:41 <vmassol> then wiki=false should be used  
17:42 <vmassol> grrrrr  
17:42 <vmassol> [ERROR] src/main/java/org/xwiki/rendering/macro/script/AbstractJSR223ScriptMacro.java[60:1] (metrics) ClassFanOutComplexity: Class Fan-Out Complexity is 21 (max allowed is 20).  
17:42 <vmassol> :)  
17:42 <tmortagne> :)  
17:42 <vmassol> how to turn a one line commit into a 1 hour job ;)  
17:43 <tmortagne> yep, manipulating XDOM generate lots of imports  
17:43 <tmortagne> then there is not much place left for others  
17:57 <evalica> has quit  
17:57 <Enygma`> has quit  
18:04 <vmassol> grrr I have found two ways to fix it but everytime I break backward compatibility  
18:15 <vmassol> so it's hard without breaking backward compat… that's one thing I hadn't realized  
18:15 <vmassol> it's very easy and there are at least 2 good ways to do it but it means refactoring and actually that's the point of this rule: to improve the design…! :)  
18:16 <vmassol> but when you don't want to break backward compat you're  bit stuck...  
18:16 <vmassol> unless you use some tricks which don't bring any value and that's not good  
18:16 <vmassol> interesting....  
18:22 <tmortagne> vmassol: maybe you have an idea about http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XCOMMONS-780  
18:23 <vmassol> not really (would need to understand what they changed)  
18:23 <vmassol> btw if this fails, then the other checksrtyle check we have should fail too  
18:23 <vmassol> I need to finish first what I'm working on now  
18:24 <tmortagne> I get only errors for ScriptServiceCheck  
18:24 <tmortagne> the change is probably specific to this use case  
18:24 <tmortagne> or nullpointer break the whole checkstyle check and other check are not executed at all  
18:25 <cjd> hmm we should put fanout rules on oldcore, then when vincent tries to commit one line of code, he'll rewrite oldcore :)  
18:25 <vmassol> good strategy :)  
18:27 <cjd> oldcore could be rewritten, would just require a super-fast build for that one module and a lot of really horrible temporary architecture which stands in until things like XWikiContext are completely demolished  
18:28 <vmassol> yes we  need to brainstorm (maybe at the seminar) on how to remove oldcore in details because right now we're adding more stuff to it than we're removing  
18:29 <tmortagne> has quit  
18:30 <cjd> the big ball of mud pattern is tried and true ;)  everybody uses it  
18:32 <cjd> similar topic: windows NT kernel is nicer code than linux, doesn't matter because linux is full of ugly annoying hacks and goto which makes it blow the doors off of everyone else in performance testing  
18:35 <vmassol> yes if you need to write real performant code then you can throw good design practices  
18:35 <vmassol> luckily we're not in that domain :)  
18:37 <cjd> well.. IMO performance is one aspect of good design  
18:40 <vmassol> there's performance and performance  
18:41 <vmassol> in our case we're writing an app that doesn't require much performance at all  
18:41 <vmassol> that's why it uses a DB, uses javva, etc  
18:41 <vmassol> \*java  
18:41 <vmassol> we're not writing a driver  
18:42 <cjd> sort of true  
18:42 <vmassol> winning a few nano seconds is not going to help us  
18:42 <vmassol> when one query on the DB takes several ms  
18:42 <vmassol> so we still need to be careful about performance  
18:42 <vmassol> but not to the level of doing hacks  
18:42 <vmassol> (design hacks)  
18:43 <vmassol> now  
18:43 <cjd> well...  
18:43 <cjd> sort of  
18:43 <cjd> :)  
18:43 <vmassol> the only thing we really need to be careful about is to not have too many calls to the DB  
18:43 <vmassol> and we need to design around that requirement  
18:43 <vmassol> (if we want performances)  
18:43 <vmassol> that's the service layer in EJB architectures for example  
18:44 <vmassol> oops got to go… bbl  
18:44 <cjd> see ya  
18:44 <cjd> xD
